remarks: Hellinger-Toeplitz Theorem: any self-adjoint linear operator defined on all of Hilbert space is bounded.  Theorem 10.1-1 of [Kreyszig] p. 525. Discovered by E. Hellinger and O. Toeplitz in 1910, "it aroused both admiration and puzzlement since the theorem establishes a relation between properties of two different kinds, namely, the properties of being defined everywhere and being bounded."  (Contributed by NM, 11-Jan-2008.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
